intro: Scorzonella bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to thrive in arid and rocky environments. Scorzonella bolanderi is often found in coastal and inland grasslands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
